title: How long are we going to pretend that items don't need to be balanced around melee/ranged?
body:
{{item:3142}} received two massive nerfs because ranged champs abused it. Its getting another nerf next patch.

{{item:3814}} is going to get the same treatment because its too strong on ranged champions.

{{item:3071}} is being changed to dissuade ranged champs from abusing it. Let pray its enough.

{{item:3053}} gutted into unviability because ranged champions abused it

{{item:3156}} was nerfed for the same thing

Lethality in general being abused on ranged champions when it was intended for assassins and melee fighters

I understand that Riot doesnt want to make a lot of items straight up Ranged/Melee only. There needs to be some sort of reduced effect to counterbalanced the innate safety of range. These items are fine on melees. Ranged gets their hands on them and gets them nerfed for everyone.

replies.body:
Lethality is too strong on melee champs as well.  I don't really understand where this is coming from.  The Black Cleaver is also not getting nerfed just for ranged, but because assassins use it too well.  It's literally only supposed to be for tanky fighters, not for squishy champs.  

The only real one that was gutted for ranged champions was Sterak's Gage, but that item had a flawed design.  There is no way unless they change how it scales that a squishy champion that can more reliably proc it isn't going to get better value out of it if it's in a decent state.  Maw of Malmortius was complained about for literally any AD champions, especially by mid laners playing against AD assassins like Zed.

Certain AD items are/have been way too strong, and they're toning it down for everyone as a result.

the lethality items were buffed because the assassins that were using them were suffering following the changes to lethality. Both talon and zed were in a meh place (ren and kha just have overtuned kits). Lethality is not too strong on melee champs as it gives them a weaker early-mid game then they used to have,  but a stronger late game.

>Lethality is not too strong on melee champs as it gives them a weaker early-mid game then they used to have, but a stronger late game.

It is no longer true since the buff, because now Lethality starts with old flat pen values while only getting better with levels.

Plus that was the whole fucking point of lethality - to make flat armor pen weaker early.

> because now Lethality starts with old flat pen values while only getting better with levels.

No it doesn't. This is just straight up incorrect. Lethality is still a straight up nerf to flat armor pen at every stage of the game except level 18

Lethality is weaker early game but breaks even much faster now. It's even more problematic in lane at the moment because it's not a viable rush if you snowball unless you're overbearingly strong compared to your lane opponent. However, second and third item it is a very strong investment because of the fact that it ramps up that much faster.

Old lethality was too weak, new lethality is too strong.  Literally everyone on the boards thinks a 0.5 starting ratio would be better.  Meddler also said that Lethality was too strong atm, and that they're going to have to nerf it somehow.
Riot stated that ADC's using the Youmuu's active was the prime reason why they took away half the active.

As an adc main, I will continue to rush ghostblade on adc... It's so much better than essence reaver and ie, i'm starting to go ghostblade then black cleaver and runaans, then ie and bt, lethality items are just more efficient than crit items, crit needs to be changed
Crit items are bad because ADCs can't scale up into Crit itemization, not that the items themselves are bad.

Also, why are we still using "ranged champion" term? Xerath is also ranged champion and he wasn't abusing these. The problem is Marksmen and we should call it that way. Maybe it's not that items would need dual balancing, but Marskmen would need change of how they work, so that they don't need/want those so much.

Finally, I like how he says:
> Lethality in general being abused on ranged champions when it was intended for assassins and melee fighters

I don't remember Lethality being aimed for melee fighters. Seems like he is Diver main who abuses Lethality, but hates ADC, so circlejerked like many others.

ADDITION: LOL, check his match history. Yops he is one of those playing Hecarim, Vi and Wukong. He wants to be tanky as Juggernaut, dealing damage as Diver, while having deletion and mobility of Assasin. He keeps abusing Juggernaut, Assasin and Tank items on Divers.

Quinn flying in doing 1500 damage in 1.2 seconds when i only have 1400 health is just bullshit. I am fine with melee assassin having that kind of power It's much more work for them to effectively get to you and get out cleanly, but ranged champs like quinn using lethality, hell no.

At least it's single target? 
Twitch does it to your whole team.
At around 30 minutes unless your team is full of squishies.
{{champion:126}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:202}}  not sure if I am missing any other ranged champs that abuse pen
{{champion:236}}
{{champion:110}}
Okay, real quick, unlike the ADC's listed above who actually use their autos, Varus uses his Q as his main source of damage, and relies heavily on that.
Lethality works on all physical damage, not sure why autos vs. q excludes him somehow

All the adc's listed above are still played as regular ADCs, just with a better early. Varus switches an entire playstyle to accommodate for building Pen, as he favors a more Siege Caster when Pen building.
Lol he still autos, just not as fast. If you get in a Leathity Varus's face he's gonna AA you lol.

Well yeah, duh, but Lethality Varus is still primarily focused on Q. Auto's are not his primary source of contributing, but they'll still hurt if someone is up in their face.

It's just like how Zed's primary source of damage is his abilities, and passive, but he can still auto you down if need be. Doesn't make him play the same as an ADC though.
Welcome to why I hate AD Casters. "lol miss my abilities? its k I can auto you to death anyways".
I mean, without attack speed, it's gonna take a while.
He functions less like an ADC and more like an AD Mage if he opts for lethality, whereas the others still pretty much play the exact same either way.
You forget that his passive also gives bonus attack speed for killing minions and more on champion kills. Sounds like he also uses autos.

And that's great, when he's playing like an ADC, but Siege Varus is still *primarily*, look at that word, look up it's definition, with his Q. He can still use Auto's, but he isn't itemizing Auto's as his main source of contribution.

He isn't itemizing attack speed and crit is what you mean. What I'm saying is that his passive gives him a little bit more freedom to play around what items he wants to build compared to most adc's. Without the AS steroid he would be shit with his "siege" build since his main source of dps aka his autos would be garbage for an adc. The passive combined with harder hitting autos compensate allow his dps to compete with other adcs. Basically I'm saying it still lets him fulfill and function as a typical adc but get away with building a pokey focused  build.

No one takes Siege Varus thinking "I'm going to auto them to death." People play him specifically for Sieging, and any added benefit from auto's is the same as any other AD Caster. It's just the same as Jayce or Zed.

no but the option keeps him relevant and useful if he is forced into a more traditional team fight scenario where he doesn't have the luxury to poke the enemy to death beforehand where dps on demand is necessary (auto attacks). His passive fills in the issues that most adc's would have if they were to try a similar build. Zed and Jayce don't have dps unlike Varus FYI (Jayce might have enough damage to not give a fuck and bebetter than most adcs for most of the game though).
Literally the same as any AD Caster.
As much as Quinn does abuse this, just how often would you ever see her?

It's funny when people include Quinn in this whole "ADCs that have become OP" when Lethality was buffed.
Quinn has ALWAYS been sleeper OP. 

She just has a really binary play-style.
Being required to win-lane and then snowball the game to victory before your 25-minute drop off.
It's not exactly intuitive by a lot of standards, not too mention besides your E and Ult she's not really that much fun to play.
Only a select few want to play a lane-bully with a time limit.
Yeah I don't see why they hate the idea of having different things for ranged and melee.

Because ADCs are the children Riot panders to 24/7.
Sort of like how Riot nerfed Thornmail and Rammus after the ADC update when people picked 3+ ADCs a game. So Thornmail and Rammus were the logical counters. But that was unacceptable apparently.
You balance according to the Meta. If Rammus is too strong, even in a Meta that puts him in optimal conditions, he'll get nerfed.

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Mercy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A9A1aa7F,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2017-02-12T04:41:12.720+0000)
>
> You balance according to the Meta. If Rammus is too strong, even in a Meta that puts him in optimal conditions, he'll get nerfed.

For someone that has a {{item:3075}} built in his kit and has a taunt was bad enough. He is an absolute counter to the ADC meta.
He is just unhealthy for a few reasons, and is why he is nerfed because of the meta.
He's a benchmark. If he is strong, adcs are way overturned
The game is never fun for melee

In my opinion, it's not very fun for melee without mobility. If you've got a Rengar or a Talon jumping on you every 30 seconds, then it's not too fun for ranged. Meanwhile, all of the Mordekaiser OTPs are doing some absurd Stormraider's Surge and Rylai's build just so it could be nearly viable. Context is everything.
{{item:3814}}  is strong on both melee and ranged champions.

not as strong though. Assassins have to dive in, thus they are easy to focus down, cc, and kill. Marksman on the other hand, have a frontline and a support peeling for them. It's already hard enough as it is to get to them, we don't need to make it harder.

No, {{item:3071}} is being nerfed because everyone and their mother is buying it. Assassins, fighters, marksmen and juggernauts are buying it and it's making armor a joke because it's so easy to fully stack it when so many people on a team have it.

Bork is gonna be disgusting on ADCs next patch

god i don't want to imagine Quinn with that fucking item top lane
I don't want to imagine Quinn toplane.
Make items give different shit depending on if ranged or melee :P
i build {{item:3085}} on {{champion:23}} all the time. its op
How about we change {{item:3053}} and give its buff duration a scaling based on bonus health, or just reduce the duration of the buff for ranged champions.

> [{quoted}](name=kasfas,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A9A1aa7F,comment-id=0021,timestamp=2017-02-12T16:08:10.496+0000)
>
> How about we change {{item:3053}} and give its buff duration a scaling based on bonus health, or just reduce the duration of the buff for ranged champions.

Or make it melee only since ranged champions have *gasp* the safety of range! 
People really under estimate just how strong an advantage range is... its funny, really.

You'muu's was an issue on melee previously (not sure about now).
Edge of Night is an issue period.
Black Cleaver has been an issue for both ever since it's rework.
Sterak's Gage is still viable on both melee and certain ranged champions.
Maw of Malmortius was an issue period.

Now don't get me wrong, I agree to at least a small degree that more items should be melee or ranged only. But please, at least pick better examples or get the facts straight about the examples you choose.

> You'muu's was an issue on melee previously (not sure about now).

No its not. It used to have half duration for ranged but they changed it. Then they nerfed the shit out of it because ranged champs were abusing it

> Edge of Night

Completely fine on melee champs they actually have to go in as opposed to prevent any sort of hard engage on ranged champs

> Black Cleaver

Was completely fine for a long time. Only became a problem when {{champion:21}} {{champion:236}} started abusing it

> Sterak's Gage 

was straight up gutted solely because ADCs picked it up

> Maw of Malmortius

Actually the problem with this item is that Hexdrinker was too efficient. It got nerfed and was fine
